newsitem.title: USA: Fed seen adding reserves via 3-day system RPs.
newsitem.headline: Fed seen adding reserves via 3-day system RPs.

text.p: The Federal Reserve is expected to inject reserves into the banking system via three-day fixed system repurchase agreements on Monday, market analysts said.
The federal funds rate was at 5-9/16 percent early Monday, above its 5-1/2 percent target.
The Fed has to enter the market, as the outstanding $3.5 billion five-day system RP runs off the books today, analysts said.
Analysts also said the Fed still needs to add permanent reserves to the system and most likely by an outright purchase of bills.
The timing of a bill pass is still up in the air, but some said it could come as early as this week if the Fed wants to keep the size small.
